intro: Nevroloma canadensis, commonly known as the Canadian nevroloma, is a species of flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The roots of Nevroloma canadensis are often used in traditional herbal remedies, though its medicinal properties remain understudied.
